overview.brief_description: Nestled along the stunning French Riviera, Nice combines Mediterranean charm with French sophistication. This coastal gem offers a perfect blend of beach life, historic architecture, and cultural richness, making it one of France's most beloved destinations.

sections.title: Mediterranean Paradise
sections.content: Nice's stunning coastline along the Baie des Anges (Bay of Angels) features the famous Promenade des Anglais, where visitors can enjoy the Mediterranean sun and sea. The city's unique pebble beaches and azure waters create an idyllic setting for relaxation and recreation.

sections.title: Historic Charm
sections.content: The Old Town (Vieux Nice) captivates with its narrow streets, colorful buildings, and Italian-influenced architecture. The city's rich history is reflected in its Baroque churches, Belle Époque buildings, and the historic Castle Hill that offers panoramic views.

sections.title: Artistic Heritage
sections.content: Nice has inspired countless artists, including Chagall and Matisse, who left their mark on the city. The Musée Matisse and Musée Chagall showcase their works, while the city's light and colors continue to influence contemporary artists.

sections.title: Mediterranean Cuisine
sections.content: Nice's culinary scene celebrates Mediterranean flavors with specialties like Salade Niçoise, Socca, and Ratatouille. The city's markets, especially the famous Cours Saleya, offer fresh local produce and regional specialties.

why_visit.intro: Nice offers a perfect blend of Mediterranean lifestyle and French culture, providing visitors with diverse experiences from beach relaxation to cultural exploration.

highlights.title: Promenade des Anglais
highlights.content: This iconic waterfront promenade stretches along the Mediterranean, offering stunning views, beach access, and a perfect spot for people-watching and sunset viewing.

highlights.title: Old Town
highlights.content: Vieux Nice's narrow streets, colorful buildings, and bustling markets create an authentic Mediterranean atmosphere. The area is filled with restaurants, bars, and shops offering local specialties.

highlights.title: Castle Hill
highlights.content: The historic hilltop park offers panoramic views of Nice and the Mediterranean. The site features waterfalls, walking paths, and the ruins of an ancient castle.

highlights.title: Art Museums
highlights.content: Nice's art museums showcase works by Matisse, Chagall, and other artists inspired by the city's light and colors. The modern art museum (MAMAC) features contemporary works.

highlights.title: Local Markets
highlights.content: The Cours Saleya market offers fresh produce, flowers, and local specialties. The market transforms into a vibrant evening scene with restaurants and bars.

highlights.title: Mediterranean Beaches
highlights.content: Nice's pebble beaches along the Baie des Anges provide perfect spots for swimming, sunbathing, and water sports, with the Alps visible in the background.

transport.public_transport: Nice has an efficient public transportation system including trams, buses, and trains. The tram system provides easy access to major attractions and neighborhoods.
transport.passes: The Ligne d'Azur pass offers unlimited travel on public transport for various durations.

spring.description: Spring brings mild temperatures and blooming flowers, perfect for exploring the city and enjoying outdoor activities. The beaches become more accessible, and tourist crowds are moderate.

summer.description: Summer is peak season with perfect beach weather and numerous festivals. The city comes alive with outdoor events and beach activities.

fall.description: Autumn offers comfortable temperatures and fewer crowds while maintaining good weather for outdoor activities. The sea remains warm enough for swimming.

winter.description: Winter brings mild temperatures compared to northern Europe, making Nice an attractive destination. The city maintains its charm with fewer tourists and lower prices.

sites.name: Promenade des Anglais
sites.description: A world-famous seafront boulevard, the Promenade des Anglais offers stunning views of the Mediterranean Sea and stretches for about 7 kilometers. It is a symbol of Nice, lined with palm trees, luxury hotels, and beaches. The promenade is perfect for strolling, cycling, or rollerblading.
sites.seasonal_notes: Busier during summer months with more tourists and events.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Early mornings are less crowded.

sites.name: Castle Hill (Colline du Château)
sites.description: Offering panoramic views of Nice, the Castle Hill is a historic site with a park, waterfalls, and ruins of the old castle. It is a popular spot for both tourists and locals to enjoy a picnic or a leisurely walk.
sites.seasonal_notes: The view is particularly stunning at sunset. Spring and fall offer pleasant weather for hiking.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Wear comfortable shoes for the hike.

sites.name: Musée Matisse
sites.description: Dedicated to the works of Henri Matisse, this museum houses one of the world's most comprehensive collections of his paintings, drawings, and sculptures. It is located in a 17th-century villa and offers insights into the artist's development.
sites.seasonal_notes: Less crowded during weekdays. Special exhibitions may attract more visitors.
sites.booking_tips: Tickets can be purchased online in advance to avoid queues.

sites.name: Vieille Ville (Old Town)
sites.description: The Old Town of Nice is a maze of narrow streets, colorful buildings, and lively markets. It is home to historic landmarks, charming cafes, and local artisan shops. The Cours Saleya market is a must-visit for fresh flowers and local produce.
sites.seasonal_notes: Very charming during the summer evenings when the streets are bustling with activity.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Early morning visits offer a quieter experience.

sites.name: Cathédrale Sainte-Réparate
sites.description: This baroque cathedral is situated in the heart of the Old Town. It is named after Nice's patron saint and features an impressive interior with elaborate decorations and beautiful frescoes.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open throughout the year, but check for special services that might limit access.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Respectful attire is recommended.

sites.name: Musée d'Art Moderne et d'Art Contemporain (MAMAC)
sites.description: MAMAC showcases a wide range of modern and contemporary art, with works by artists such as Yves Klein and Andy Warhol. The museum's architecture itself is a modernist landmark.
sites.seasonal_notes: Special exhibitions can increase visitor numbers, but generally manageable.
sites.booking_tips: Tickets are available online and at the entrance.

sites.name: Place Masséna
sites.description: The central square of Nice, Place Masséna is known for its vibrant red buildings, checkerboard pavement, and the iconic fountain. It hosts public events and is a hub for shopping and dining.
sites.seasonal_notes: The square is beautifully illuminated during the winter holidays.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Great for evening strolls.

sites.name: Parc Phoenix
sites.description: A large botanical garden and zoo, Parc Phoenix features a wide variety of plants and animals. The park is home to one of Europe's largest greenhouses and offers interactive exhibits for children.
sites.seasonal_notes: Ideal for family visits, especially during spring when flowers are in bloom.
sites.booking_tips: Tickets can be purchased on-site. Consider bringing a picnic.

sites.name: Russian Orthodox Cathedral
sites.description: A stunning example of Russian architecture, the Saint Nicholas Cathedral in Nice is the largest Eastern Orthodox cathedral in Western Europe. It features ornate interiors and a beautiful exterior with vibrant onion domes.
sites.seasonal_notes: Check for religious holidays that may affect visiting hours.
sites.booking_tips: Guided tours are available and recommended for deeper insights.

sites.name: Cours Saleya Market
sites.description: A vibrant market in the heart of the Old Town, known for its flowers, fresh produce, and local specialties. The Cours Saleya transforms into an antiques market on Mondays.
sites.seasonal_notes: Bustling atmosphere, especially during summer and weekends.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Early visits offer the freshest finds.

sites.name: Jardin Albert 1er
sites.description: One of the city's oldest public gardens, Jardin Albert 1er is a green oasis in the city center, featuring fountains, sculptures, and a playground. It is adjacent to the Promenade des Anglais.
sites.seasonal_notes: Pleasant year-round, with a lively atmosphere during the summer.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Ideal for a relaxing break.

sites.name: Musée National Marc Chagall
sites.description: Dedicated to the works of Marc Chagall, this museum houses the largest public collection of his paintings, especially those related to biblical themes. The museum's setting and architecture complement the artworks.
sites.seasonal_notes: Special exhibitions may attract more visitors.
sites.booking_tips: Online ticket purchase is recommended to avoid lines.

sites.name: Mont Boron
sites.description: A lush hilltop park offering hiking trails and panoramic views of Nice and the surrounding Mediterranean coastline. It is a popular spot for picnics and outdoor activities.
sites.seasonal_notes: Less crowded in early mornings or late afternoons.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Bring water and comfortable shoes.

sites.name: Place Garibaldi
sites.description: A historic square with beautiful arcades and a statue of Giuseppe Garibaldi. It is surrounded by cafes and shops, offering a lively atmosphere and a taste of local life.
sites.seasonal_notes: Popular during evenings with locals dining out.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Enjoy a meal at one of the cafes.

sites.name: Parc du Château
sites.description: Located atop Castle Hill, this park offers stunning views, historical ruins, and beautifully landscaped gardens. It is a tranquil escape from the city's hustle.
sites.seasonal_notes: Perfect for sunset views. Pathways can be slippery after rain.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Accessible by foot or lift.

sites.name: Avenue Jean Médecin
sites.description: A central shopping street in Nice, lined with a mix of high street and luxury stores, cafes, and restaurants. It is a bustling area that acts as a commercial hub.
sites.seasonal_notes: Busy during sales and holiday seasons.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Visit on weekdays for a less crowded experience.

sites.name: Palais Lascaris
sites.description: A hidden gem in the Old Town, this 17th-century aristocratic mansion showcases baroque architecture and hosts a collection of musical instruments and period furnishings.
sites.seasonal_notes: A quieter alternative to larger museums.
sites.booking_tips: Tickets available at the entrance. Guided tours enhance the experience.

sites.name: Place Rossetti
sites.description: A charming square in the heart of the Old Town, known for its lively atmosphere, ice cream parlors, and the beautiful Sainte-Réparate Cathedral. It is a perfect spot for enjoying a coffee and people-watching.
sites.seasonal_notes: Popular during summer evenings.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Try the famous Fenocchio ice cream.

sites.name: Opéra de Nice
sites.description: An elegant opera house that hosts a variety of performances, including opera, ballet, and concerts. It is renowned for its acoustics and architectural beauty.
sites.seasonal_notes: Check the schedule for seasonal performances and special events.
sites.booking_tips: Tickets should be booked in advance, especially for popular shows.

sites.name: Quai des États-Unis
sites.description: An extension of the Promenade des Anglais, this seafront walkway offers beautiful views of the Baie des Anges and is a popular spot for walking and cycling.
sites.seasonal_notes: Ideal for a morning walk or run. Can be windy during winter.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Combine with a visit to nearby beaches.

sites.name: Plage Beau Rivage
sites.description: One of Nice's most popular private beaches, offering sunbeds, umbrellas, and beachside dining. The beach features crystal-clear waters and stunning views of the Mediterranean.
sites.seasonal_notes: Peak season from June to September. Beach services available during summer months.
sites.booking_tips: Sunbed rentals available. Arrive early to secure a good spot.

sites.name: Plage de la Réserve
sites.description: A quieter alternative to the main beaches, offering a more relaxed atmosphere with beautiful views. The beach is popular with locals and offers a more authentic experience.
sites.seasonal_notes: Less crowded than other beaches. Ideal for swimming and sunbathing.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Bring your own beach equipment.

sites.name: Port Lympia
sites.description: Nice's main port area, featuring colorful buildings, fishing boats, and a vibrant atmosphere. The port is home to restaurants, cafes, and offers beautiful views of the Mediterranean.
sites.seasonal_notes: Beautiful at sunset. Popular for dining and evening strolls.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Great for photography and dining.

sites.name: Théâtre de Verdure
sites.description: An open-air theater located in the Jardin Albert 1er, hosting concerts, performances, and cultural events during the summer months. The venue offers a unique outdoor entertainment experience.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open during summer months. Check schedule for performances.
sites.booking_tips: Tickets available online and at the venue. Arrive early for good seats.

sites.name: Cimiez Roman Ruins
sites.description: Ancient Roman ruins including an amphitheater, thermal baths, and archaeological remains. The site offers insights into Nice's Roman history and provides beautiful views of the city.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round. Combine with Matisse Museum visit.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Guided tours available.

sites.name: Musée des Beaux-Arts
sites.description: Housed in a beautiful 19th-century mansion, this museum features an impressive collection of paintings, sculptures, and decorative arts from the 16th to 20th centuries.
sites.seasonal_notes: Less crowded than other museums. Special exhibitions throughout the year.
sites.booking_tips: Free admission. Check for temporary exhibitions.

sites.name: Parc du Mont Boron
sites.description: A large hilltop park offering hiking trails, picnic areas, and panoramic views of Nice and the Mediterranean. The park is popular with locals for outdoor activities and relaxation.
sites.seasonal_notes: Beautiful year-round. Spring offers blooming flowers and pleasant temperatures.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Wear comfortable walking shoes.

sites.name: Promenade du Paillon
sites.description: A modern urban park featuring water features, playgrounds, and green spaces. The park connects the city center with the train station and offers a peaceful escape from the urban environment.
sites.seasonal_notes: Popular with families. Water features operate during warmer months.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Ideal for families with children.

sites.name: Chapelle du Saint-Sépulcre
sites.description: A beautiful baroque chapel located in the Old Town, featuring ornate decorations and religious artwork. The chapel is a peaceful place for reflection and photography.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round. Check for religious services.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Respectful attire recommended.

sites.name: Galerie des Ponchettes
sites.description: A contemporary art gallery housed in a historic building near the Promenade des Anglais. The gallery showcases local and international artists with rotating exhibitions.
sites.seasonal_notes: Check for current exhibitions. Less crowded than major museums.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Free admission.

sites.name: Observatoire de Nice
sites.description: A historic astronomical observatory located on Mont Gros, offering guided tours and insights into astronomy. The observatory provides stunning views of Nice and the surrounding area.
sites.seasonal_notes: Tours available on specific days. Check schedule in advance.
sites.booking_tips: Advance booking required for tours. Limited availability.

sites.name: Cimetière du Château
sites.description: A historic cemetery located on Castle Hill, featuring beautiful monuments and offering panoramic views of Nice. The cemetery is a peaceful place for reflection and photography.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round. Respectful behavior required.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Quiet and respectful atmosphere.

sites.name: Villa Ephrussi de Rothschild
sites.description: A stunning villa and gardens located in Saint-Jean-Cap-Ferrat, just outside Nice. The villa features beautiful architecture, art collections, and spectacular gardens with sea views.
sites.seasonal_notes: Beautiful year-round. Spring offers blooming gardens.
sites.booking_tips: Advance booking recommended. Combine with garden visit.

sites.name: Cap de Nice
sites.description: A scenic viewpoint offering panoramic views of the Mediterranean and the Nice coastline. The area is popular for photography and sunset viewing.
sites.seasonal_notes: Beautiful at sunset. Can be windy during winter.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Great for photography.

sites.name: Gare de Nice-Ville
sites.description: Nice's main train station, featuring beautiful architecture and serving as a major transportation hub. The station connects Nice to other cities in France and Europe.
sites.seasonal_notes: Busy during peak travel seasons.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required for station access. Book train tickets in advance.

sites.name: Allianz Riviera
sites.description: A modern football stadium home to OGC Nice. The stadium hosts football matches and other sporting events, offering a great atmosphere for sports enthusiasts.
sites.seasonal_notes: Match schedules vary throughout the year.
sites.booking_tips: Book tickets in advance for matches. Check schedule online.

neighborhoods.name: Vieux Nice
neighborhoods.character: Charming and historic with narrow streets and vibrant markets.

location.description: Located at the heart of Nice, near the sea.

history.overview: The oldest part of Nice, with a history dating back to Roman times.
history.significance: Cultural and historical heart of Nice, showcasing Baroque architecture.

practical_info.safety: Generally safe, but watch for pickpockets in crowded areas.
practical_info.best_time_to_visit: Morning for markets, evening for dining.
practical_info.walkability: Highly pedestrian-friendly, though cobblestones can be challenging.

attractions.name: Cours Saleya
attractions.description: A vibrant market selling flowers, produce, and local delicacies.
attractions.appeal: Experience local flavors and lively atmosphere.

attractions.name: Palais Lascaris
attractions.description: A 17th-century aristocratic mansion showcasing Baroque architecture.
attractions.appeal: Insight into Nice's aristocratic past.

attractions.name: Cathedral Sainte-Réparate
attractions.description: A beautiful Baroque cathedral in the heart of Old Town.
attractions.appeal: Stunning architecture and historical significance.

activities.name: Guided Walking Tour
activities.description: Explore the history and architecture of Vieux Nice with a local guide.

activities.name: Market Shopping
activities.description: Browse the vibrant stalls of Cours Saleya for local goods and souvenirs.

stay_here_if: You love historic charm and being in the city center.
You enjoy bustling markets and vibrant nightlife.
avoid_if: You prefer quiet and less crowded areas.
You have mobility issues with cobblestone streets.
insider_tips: Visit early morning for the freshest market produce.
Try the socca at local stalls for an authentic taste.

neighborhoods.name: Cimiez
neighborhoods.character: Elegant and peaceful, known for its Roman ruins and museums.

location.description: Located on the hills northeast of the city center.

history.overview: Once a Roman settlement, now a prestigious residential area.
history.significance: Historical site with Roman ruins and a long tradition of cultural significance.

practical_info.best_time_to_visit: Spring and fall for pleasant weather and fewer crowds.
practical_info.walkability: Hilly terrain, but manageable for most visitors.

attractions.name: Matisse Museum
attractions.description: Dedicated to the works of Henri Matisse, located in a historic villa.
attractions.appeal: Extensive collection of Matisse's art.

attractions.name: Cimiez Monastery
attractions.description: A historic monastery with beautiful gardens and panoramic views.
attractions.appeal: Offers tranquility and stunning vistas.

attractions.name: Roman Amphitheatre
attractions.description: Ruins of a Roman amphitheater in a picturesque setting.
attractions.appeal: A glimpse into Nice's ancient past.

dining.name: Bistrot de l’École de Nice
dining.known_for: Traditional French dishes with a modern twist

dining.name: Le Jardin du Monastère
dining.known_for: Tea and pastries with a view

activities.name: Picnic in the Gardens
activities.description: Enjoy a peaceful picnic in the monastery gardens.

activities.name: Museum Hopping
activities.description: Explore the Matisse and Archaeological museums.

stay_here_if: You prefer a quiet, residential area with cultural attractions.
You enjoy historical sites and peaceful surroundings.
avoid_if: You want vibrant nightlife and shopping options.
You dislike hilly terrain.
insider_tips: Visit the monastery gardens at sunset for a beautiful view.
Check for special exhibitions at the Matisse Museum.

neighborhoods.name: Promenade des Anglais
neighborhoods.character: Iconic seafront walkway lined with beaches and palm trees.

location.description: Runs along the Mediterranean coast from the airport to the eastern part of Nice.

history.overview: Established in the 19th century as a winter retreat for English aristocrats.
history.significance: Symbol of Nice and a major tourist attraction.

practical_info.safety: Generally safe during the day; stay vigilant at night.
practical_info.walkability: Extremely walkable with a dedicated pedestrian path.

attractions.name: Hotel Negresco
attractions.description: A landmark hotel known for its opulent decor and historic significance.
attractions.appeal: Experience luxury and history together.

attractions.name: Blue Beach
attractions.description: One of the private beaches offering sun loungers and dining.
attractions.appeal: Relax in style with beachfront services.

attractions.name: Palais de la Méditerranée
attractions.description: A luxury hotel and casino complex with Art Deco architecture.
attractions.appeal: Enjoy entertainment and elegant surroundings.

activities.name: Cycling on the Promenade
activities.description: Rent a bike and enjoy a ride along the scenic coastline.

activities.name: Sunset Stroll
activities.description: Walk along the promenade as the sun sets over the Mediterranean.

stay_here_if: You want easy access to the beach and luxury accommodations.
You enjoy scenic walks and ocean views.
avoid_if: You prefer quieter, less touristy areas.
You are on a tight budget.
insider_tips: Catch the sunset from the promenade for stunning views.
Look for local events and music performances along the walkway.

neighborhoods.name: Libération
neighborhoods.character: Vibrant and bustling with a strong local vibe.

location.description: North of the city center, centered around the old train station.

history.overview: A neighborhood that grew around the old train station, now a cultural hub.
history.significance: Known for its local market and recent urban renewal projects.

practical_info.safety: Safe, with a lively local atmosphere.
practical_info.walkability: Fairly walkable with many pedestrian-friendly areas.

attractions.name: Gare du Sud
attractions.description: The old station turned into a cultural and dining hub.
attractions.appeal: Enjoy diverse dining options and cultural events.

attractions.name: Libération Market
attractions.description: A bustling market offering fresh produce and local goods.
attractions.appeal: Experience the local flavor and vibrant atmosphere.

activities.name: Market Shopping
activities.description: Explore the local market for fresh produce and artisan goods.

activities.name: Cultural Events
activities.description: Check out events at the Gare du Sud cultural center.

stay_here_if: You want to experience local life and vibrant markets.
You enjoy cultural events and diverse dining options.
avoid_if: You prefer quieter, less developed areas.
You dislike bustling, busy environments.
insider_tips: Visit the market early for the best selection of produce.
Check out the various dining options at Gare du Sud.

neighborhoods.name: Mont Boron
neighborhoods.character: Upscale residential area with stunning views and natural beauty.

location.description: East of the city center on a prominent hill.

history.overview: Developed in the 19th century as a retreat for the wealthy.
history.significance: Known for its luxury villas and panoramic views.
notable_events: Construction of the Mont Boron Park
Historical significance in the defense of Nice

practical_info.safety: Very safe and quiet, with a strong residential presence.
practical_info.best_time_to_visit: Anytime for hiking and views, especially at sunset.
practical_info.walkability: Hilly terrain but rewarding for those who enjoy walking.

attractions.name: Mont Boron Park
attractions.description: A large park with hiking trails and stunning views of the city and sea.
attractions.appeal: Ideal for outdoor activities and scenic vistas.

attractions.name: Fort of Mont Alban
attractions.description: A 16th-century fort offering panoramic views of the coastline.
attractions.appeal: Historical site with breathtaking views.

dining.name: Le Plongeoir
dining.known_for: Unique setting on a rock pillar

activities.name: Hiking
activities.description: Explore the trails in Mont Boron Park for exercise and views.

activities.name: Photography
activities.description: Capture stunning photos of the French Riviera from the hill.

stay_here_if: You prioritize stunning views and luxury accommodations.
You enjoy outdoor activities and natural beauty.
avoid_if: You need easy access to nightlife and shopping.
You prefer flat, easily navigable terrain.
insider_tips: Bring a camera for breathtaking sunset shots.
Wear comfortable shoes for hiking the trails.

neighborhoods.name: Riquier
neighborhoods.character: Up-and-coming neighborhood with a mix of old and new.

location.description: East of the city center, near the Port of Nice.

history.overview: Traditionally a working-class area, now experiencing gentrification.
history.significance: Known for its proximity to the port and evolving cultural scene.

practical_info.safety: Generally safe, with ongoing development improving the area.
practical_info.best_time_to_visit: Evenings for dining and local nightlife.
practical_info.walkability: Easily walkable with many pedestrian areas.

attractions.name: Place du Pin
attractions.description: A lively square with cafes and bars, popular for its nightlife.
attractions.appeal: Great place for socializing and enjoying the local scene.

attractions.name: Galerie Lympia
attractions.description: Contemporary art gallery located in a historic building.
attractions.appeal: Experience local and international art exhibitions.

activities.name: Bar Hopping
activities.description: Explore the vibrant bar scene around Place du Pin.

activities.name: Art Exhibitions
activities.description: Visit Galerie Lympia for contemporary art displays.

stay_here_if: You enjoy a trendy, evolving neighborhood with a vibrant nightlife.
You want easy access to the port and cultural attractions.
avoid_if: You prefer more established and quiet areas.
You dislike urban development and construction.
insider_tips: Check out local art events and pop-up galleries.
Visit Place du Pin for a lively evening atmosphere.

neighborhoods.name: Port of Nice
neighborhoods.character: Picturesque harbor area with a mix of old-world charm and modern amenities.

location.description: East of Vieux Nice, along the waterfront.

history.overview: A historic port area that has long been a center of maritime activity.
history.significance: Key to Nice's development as a trade and tourism hub.

practical_info.safety: Safe and well-patrolled, though busy with tourists.
practical_info.best_time_to_visit: Afternoon for boat watching, evening for dining.
practical_info.walkability: Very walkable with scenic waterfront paths.

attractions.name: Port Lympia
attractions.description: A bustling port with yachts and fishing boats.
attractions.appeal: Enjoy scenic views and maritime activity.

attractions.name: Colline du Château
attractions.description: A hilltop park with ruins and panoramic views of the city and sea.
attractions.appeal: Offers one of the best viewpoints in Nice.

activities.name: Boat Tours
activities.description: Explore the coastline with guided boat tours.

activities.name: Fishing
activities.description: Join local fishermen on a fishing excursion.

stay_here_if: You enjoy beautiful harbor views and seafood dining.
You appreciate maritime history and activities.
avoid_if: You prefer inland locations.
You dislike crowded tourist areas.
insider_tips: Try fresh seafood at one of the local eateries.
Visit the park on Colline du Château for stunning city views.

neighborhoods.name: Musiciens
neighborhoods.character: Elegant and centrally located, known for its Belle Époque architecture.

location.description: North of the Promenade des Anglais, close to the train station.

history.overview: Developed in the late 19th century, reflecting Nice's architectural boom.
history.significance: Named for streets honoring famous composers.

practical_info.safety: Safe, with a residential feel and tourist-friendly amenities.
practical_info.best_time_to_visit: Spring and fall for pleasant weather.
practical_info.walkability: Highly walkable with wide pavements and tree-lined streets.

attractions.name: Notre-Dame Basilica
attractions.description: A stunning basilica inspired by Gothic architecture.
attractions.appeal: A serene and beautiful place of worship.

attractions.name: Thiers Train Station
attractions.description: A major train station with historic architecture.
attractions.appeal: Gateway for exploring the French Riviera.

activities.name: Architecture Tour
activities.description: Explore the Belle Époque architecture with a guided tour.

activities.name: Classical Music Concert
activities.description: Attend a concert in one of the local venues.

stay_here_if: You appreciate classic architecture and a central location.
You require convenient access to public transit.
avoid_if: You prefer modern, minimalist areas.
You dislike busy urban settings.
insider_tips: Look up during your walk to admire architectural details.
Attend a local concert for an authentic cultural experience.

neighborhoods.name: Fabron
neighborhoods.character: Residential and quiet, with beautiful sea views and green spaces.

location.description: West of the city center along the coast.

history.overview: Developed as a residential area with villas and gardens.
history.significance: Known for its peaceful environment and scenic views.

practical_info.walkability: Moderately walkable with some hilly areas.

attractions.name: Parc Carol de Roumanie
attractions.description: A large park with playgrounds and sports facilities.
attractions.appeal: Ideal for families and outdoor activities.

attractions.name: Fabron Chapel
attractions.description: A charming chapel with historical significance.
attractions.appeal: Offers a glimpse into local religious history.

activities.name: Beach Day
activities.description: Spend a day at the beach enjoying sun and sea.

activities.name: Park Picnic
activities.description: Enjoy a relaxing picnic in the park.

stay_here_if: You want a quiet, residential area near the beach.
You enjoy outdoor activities and family-friendly environments.
avoid_if: You prefer vibrant nightlife and shopping.
You need direct tram access.
insider_tips: Bring a picnic to enjoy in Parc Carol de Roumanie.
Explore the area on foot to discover hidden viewpoints.

neighborhoods.name: Jean-Médecin
neighborhoods.character: Busy commercial district with shopping and dining options.

location.description: Runs through the center of Nice from the train station to Place Masséna.

history.overview: Central artery of Nice, developed as a major shopping area.
history.significance: Main commercial street and hub for urban life.

practical_info.safety: Safe, but busy with shoppers and tourists.

attractions.name: Nice Étoile
attractions.description: A large shopping center with a variety of stores.
attractions.appeal: Shop for international brands and local goods.

attractions.name: Place Masséna
attractions.description: A central square known for its architecture and events.
attractions.appeal: A lively meeting point with beautiful surroundings.

activities.name: Shopping Spree
activities.description: Explore the shops along Avenue Jean Médecin.

activities.name: Café Hopping
activities.description: Enjoy coffee and pastries at local cafés.

stay_here_if: You want to be in the heart of the shopping district.
You enjoy vibrant urban life and convenience.
avoid_if: You prefer quiet residential neighborhoods.
You dislike crowded areas.
insider_tips: Visit during sales for great deals.
Stop by Place Masséna for a photo opportunity.

fine_dining.name: Le Chantecler
fine_dining.atmosphere: Elegant dining room with a classic French decor
fine_dining.booking_tips: Book at least two weeks in advance for weekends
fine_dining.local_tips: Request a table with a sea view for a memorable experience.

fine_dining.name: Jan
fine_dining.cuisine_type: Modern French with South African influences
fine_dining.booking_tips: Reserve a month in advance for weekend evenings
fine_dining.local_tips: The wine pairing option is highly recommended for a complete experience.

fine_dining.name: L'Aromate
fine_dining.atmosphere: Modern minimalist with a cozy feel
fine_dining.booking_tips: Weekday reservations are easier to secure
fine_dining.local_tips: Opt for the tasting menu to experience the chef's creativity.

fine_dining.name: Keisuke Matsushima
fine_dining.atmosphere: Sleek and modern with Japanese design elements
fine_dining.booking_tips: Book a few days in advance for a guaranteed spot
fine_dining.local_tips: The chef’s omakase menu is a must-try for adventurous diners.

casual_dining.name: La Merenda
casual_dining.atmosphere: Rustic and cozy with a warm vibe
casual_dining.booking_tips: No phone reservations; arrive early to secure a table
casual_dining.local_tips: Cash only; try the daily specials for a surprise.

casual_dining.name: Olive & Artichaut
casual_dining.atmosphere: Charming and artistic with a relaxed setting
casual_dining.booking_tips: Book a day in advance, particularly in the summer
casual_dining.local_tips: Ask for a table on the terrace for a lovely street view.

casual_dining.name: Le Plongeoir
casual_dining.atmosphere: Unique over-the-water setting with a nautical theme
casual_dining.booking_tips: Reserve a week ahead for sunset views
casual_dining.local_tips: Try to visit at sunset for a spectacular view across the Mediterranean.

casual_dining.name: Chez Acchiardo
casual_dining.atmosphere: Family-run with a homely and welcoming feel
casual_dining.booking_tips: Call in advance, especially for larger groups
casual_dining.local_tips: The house wine is a great accompaniment to their traditional dishes.

casual_dining.name: Peixes
casual_dining.atmosphere: Trendy and lively with a contemporary vibe
casual_dining.booking_tips: Arrive early to avoid the lunchtime rush
casual_dining.local_tips: The tapas-style menu is perfect for sharing—try a bit of everything.

casual_dining.name: Bistrot d'Antoine
casual_dining.atmosphere: Classic bistro with a bustling and friendly ambiance
casual_dining.booking_tips: Book a few days in advance for dinner
casual_dining.local_tips: Their wine selection is excellent, ask the staff for pairing suggestions.

street_food.name: Lou Pilha Leva
street_food.local_tips: Visit during off-peak hours to avoid long lines. Try the Socca with a glass of rosé.

street_food.name: Chez Thérésa
street_food.local_tips: Great for a quick snack while exploring the market. The Socca is best enjoyed hot.

street_food.name: Fenocchio Glacier
street_food.local_tips: Perfect for a sweet treat. Try unique flavors like lavender or cactus.

street_food.name: Lou Nissart
street_food.local_tips: Panisse is a must-try here. It's best enjoyed fresh and hot.

coffee_shops.name: Café de Turin
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Historical café with a lively and bustling atmosphere
coffee_shops.local_tips: Pair your coffee with fresh oysters for a unique experience.

coffee_shops.name: Emilie and the Cool Kids
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Hip and cozy with a laid-back vibe
coffee_shops.local_tips: Great spot for remote work or a casual meet-up.

coffee_shops.name: Marinette
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Charming and quaint with a vintage decor
coffee_shops.local_tips: Their brunch is popular, so come early to grab a seat.

coffee_shops.name: Café Marché
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Eco-friendly with a modern minimalist design
coffee_shops.local_tips: Perfect for health-conscious eaters; try their daily specials.

bars.name: Movida
bars.specialty: Creative cocktails with a Mediterranean twist
bars.atmosphere: Vibrant with a stunning sea view
bars.local_tips: Grab a spot on the terrace for the best sunset views.

bars.name: La Part des Anges
bars.atmosphere: Cozy with a rustic and intimate setting
bars.local_tips: Ask the staff for wine recommendations based on your taste preferences.

bars.name: Wayne's Bar
bars.atmosphere: Lively and energetic with live music performances
bars.local_tips: Popular with both locals and tourists, especially on weekends.

bars.name: Le Shapko
bars.atmosphere: Sophisticated with a relaxed jazz club vibe
bars.local_tips: Check their schedule for special jazz performances.

bars.name: Le Bar des Oiseaux
bars.atmosphere: Artistic and eclectic with a warm ambiance
bars.local_tips: Perfect for pre-dinner drinks, try their seasonal cocktails.

food_tours.name: Nice Food and Wine Tour
food_tours.booking_tips: Book at least a week in advance, especially during high season.

food_tours.name: Gourmet Walking Tour of Nice
food_tours.booking_tips: Book a few days in advance; morning tours are less crowded.

food_tours.name: Culinary Secrets of Nice
food_tours.booking_tips: Popular with foodies—reserve your spot early.

cooking_classes.name: Niçoise Cooking Class
includes: Ingredients, recipe book, meal at the end
cooking_classes.booking_tips: Best booked a week in advance; morning classes offer a market tour.

cooking_classes.name: Mediterranean Feast Cooking Class
cooking_classes.booking_tips: Ideal for groups; inquire about private sessions for special occasions.

markets.name: Marché aux Fleurs Cours Saleya
markets.local_tips: Visit early to avoid crowds and for the best selection of fresh produce.

markets.name: Marché de la Libération
markets.local_tips: Bargain with vendors for the best prices; bring cash for purchases.

Known for its green spaces and museums.

activities.name: Nice Carnival
activities.description: The Nice Carnival is one of the world's major carnival events, held annually since the 13th century. The event features parades with giant floats, flower battles, and vibrant street performances.
activities.seasonal_notes: Spring is when the Nice Carnival takes place, with the city coming alive with colors and festivities.
activities.booking_tips: Purchase tickets in advance online as they sell out quickly. Arrive early to secure a good viewing spot.

activities.name: Promenade des Anglais
activities.description: A charming walk along the Mediterranean coast, offering stunning views and a chance to enjoy the mild spring weather.
activities.seasonal_notes: Spring offers pleasant temperatures, making it ideal for a leisurely stroll along the promenade.
activities.booking_tips: No booking needed, but consider starting early in the morning to enjoy a quieter experience.

activities.name: Parc Phoenix
activities.description: Explore 7 hectares of botanical gardens and a tropical greenhouse with exotic plants and animals.
activities.seasonal_notes: Spring flowers bloom throughout Parc Phoenix, offering a colorful and fragrant experience.
activities.booking_tips: Tickets can be purchased at the entrance. Consider visiting during weekdays to avoid crowds.

activities.name: Matisse Museum
activities.description: Dedicated to the works of Henri Matisse, this museum showcases a vast collection of the artist's paintings, sculptures, and engravings.
activities.seasonal_notes: Spring showers make it an excellent time to explore indoor attractions like the Matisse Museum.
activities.booking_tips: Buy tickets online to skip the queue. Guided tours are available and recommended.

activities.name: Old Town (Vieux Nice)
activities.description: Wander through the narrow streets of Old Town, exploring its colorful buildings, vibrant markets, and charming cafes.
activities.seasonal_notes: Spring weather is perfect for exploring the outdoor markets and enjoying al fresco dining.
activities.booking_tips: No booking required. Wear comfortable shoes for walking on cobblestone streets.

activities.name: Colline du Château
activities.description: This historic hilltop offers panoramic views of Nice and the Bay of Angels, with ruins of an ancient castle.
activities.seasonal_notes: Spring is ideal for hiking up the hill, with cooler temperatures and blooming flowers.
activities.booking_tips: No booking necessary. Bring water and a camera for the stunning views.

activities.name: Cours Saleya Flower Market
activities.description: A vibrant open-air market in the heart of Nice, offering a wide array of fresh flowers, local produce, and artisanal goods.
activities.seasonal_notes: Spring is the best time to see the market at its most colorful, with a stunning variety of flowers.
activities.booking_tips: Arrive early to avoid crowds and get the freshest selections.

activities.name: Villa Ephrussi de Rothschild
activities.description: A beautiful villa located on the Saint-Jean-Cap-Ferrat peninsula, featuring exquisite gardens and luxurious interior decor.
activities.seasonal_notes: Spring brings the gardens to life, making it an ideal time to visit.
activities.booking_tips: Book tickets online for guided tours, especially during weekends.

activities.name: Nice Jazz Festival
activities.description: Held annually in July, the Nice Jazz Festival hosts international artists and offers a mix of genres in a vibrant atmosphere.
activities.seasonal_notes: Summer nights are perfect for enjoying outdoor concerts under the stars.
activities.booking_tips: Tickets sell out fast, so book early online. Bring a picnic blanket and arrive early for good seating.

activities.name: Plage Beau Rivage
activities.description: A popular beach along the Promenade des Anglais with opportunities for sunbathing, swimming, and water sports.
activities.seasonal_notes: Summer is the best time for beach activities, with warm sea temperatures and sunny skies.
activities.booking_tips: Sunbeds can be reserved in advance during peak season. Bring sunscreen and a hat.

activities.name: Water Sports at Saint-Laurent-du-Var
activities.description: Engage in thrilling water sports like jet skiing, parasailing, and paddleboarding on the Mediterranean Sea.
activities.seasonal_notes: The calm summer seas provide perfect conditions for water sports enthusiasts.
activities.booking_tips: Book activities online in advance for better rates and availability.

activities.name: Castle Hill Park
activities.description: Explore the lush greenery, waterfalls, and historical ruins at Castle Hill, offering breathtaking views of Nice.
activities.seasonal_notes: Summer mornings are cooler and ideal for hiking and photography.
activities.booking_tips: No booking needed. Wear comfortable shoes and bring water.

activities.name: Les Grandes Tables de la Friche
activities.description: An open-air dining experience featuring gourmet meals with a focus on local and organic ingredients.
activities.seasonal_notes: Summer evenings offer perfect weather for dining outdoors under the stars.
activities.booking_tips: Reservations are recommended, especially on weekends. Check their menu online in advance.

activities.name: Nice Observatory
activities.description: Located on Mont Gros, the observatory offers guided tours and night sky viewing sessions.
activities.seasonal_notes: Clear summer skies provide excellent conditions for stargazing.
activities.booking_tips: Advance booking is essential for night sessions. Bring a light jacket as it can be cool at night.

activities.name: Parc de la Colline du Château
activities.description: This park on Castle Hill offers lush gardens, waterfalls, and panoramic views of the city and coastline.
activities.seasonal_notes: Summer afternoons are ideal for relaxing in the shade and enjoying the scenic views.
activities.booking_tips: No booking required. Bring a picnic to enjoy in the park.

activities.name: Canyoning in the Verdon Gorge
activities.description: Experience the thrill of canyoning in one of Europe's most beautiful gorges, with jumps, slides, and abseils.
activities.seasonal_notes: Summer is the best season for canyoning, with warm weather and safe water levels.
activities.booking_tips: Book a guided tour with a local operator for safety and the best routes. Wear appropriate gear.

activities.name: Vendanges de Nice
activities.description: Celebrate the local wine harvest with tastings, music, and traditional dances in the vineyards surrounding Nice.
activities.seasonal_notes: Autumn is harvest season, making it the perfect time to enjoy local wine festivals.
activities.booking_tips: Consider joining a tour for easier access to vineyards and tastings.

activities.name: Nice Art Fair
activities.description: An annual event showcasing contemporary art from local and international artists at the Palais des Expositions.
activities.seasonal_notes: Autumn brings a focus on cultural events, and the art fair is a highlight of the season.
activities.booking_tips: Buy tickets online to skip queues. Check the schedule for special artist talks and workshops.

activities.name: Olive Harvest Tour
activities.description: Join a guided tour of local olive groves to learn about the harvesting process and enjoy tastings of fresh olive oil.
activities.seasonal_notes: The olive harvest occurs in autumn, offering a unique cultural experience.
activities.booking_tips: Book tours in advance as spots can be limited, especially during peak harvest times.

activities.name: Monastere de Cimiez
activities.description: Visit this ancient monastery surrounded by gardens, offering historical insights and peaceful surroundings.
activities.seasonal_notes: Cooler autumn weather is ideal for exploring historical sites.
activities.booking_tips: No booking required, but check opening hours as they may vary seasonally.

activities.name: Baie des Anges Cruise
activities.description: Enjoy a scenic cruise around the Bay of Angels, taking in the stunning coastline and crystal-clear waters.
activities.seasonal_notes: Autumn offers calmer seas and mild weather, perfect for a leisurely cruise.
activities.booking_tips: Book in advance during weekends. Bring a light jacket as it can be breezy on the water.

activities.name: Cours Saleya Antique Market
activities.description: Discover unique antiques and vintage treasures at this popular market held every Monday in Old Nice.
activities.seasonal_notes: The autumn market is less crowded, allowing for a more relaxed shopping experience.
activities.booking_tips: Arrive early for the best finds. No booking required.

activities.name: Nice Opera House
activities.description: Experience world-class performances in a stunning historical venue, with a diverse program of operas, ballets, and concerts.
activities.seasonal_notes: Autumn is a popular time for cultural performances, with a full schedule at the opera house.
activities.booking_tips: Purchase tickets online in advance for popular shows. Dress code may apply.

activities.name: Hiking in Mercantour National Park
activities.description: Explore the rugged beauty of Mercantour National Park with its diverse flora and fauna and stunning autumn foliage.
activities.seasonal_notes: The autumn colors make hiking in the park particularly beautiful.
activities.booking_tips: No booking required, but check trail conditions and weather forecasts before heading out.

activities.name: Christmas Village in Nice
activities.description: Experience the magic of the holiday season with a festive market, ice skating rink, and holiday-themed attractions.
activities.seasonal_notes: Winter brings festive cheer to Nice with the annual Christmas Village.
activities.booking_tips: No booking required. Visit during weekdays to avoid crowds.

activities.name: Skiing in the Alps
activities.description: Just a short drive from Nice, enjoy skiing and snowboarding in the Alps at resorts like Isola 2000 and Auron.
activities.seasonal_notes: Winter is the perfect time to hit the slopes in the nearby Alps.
activities.booking_tips: Book accommodations and ski passes in advance for the best rates.

activities.name: Carnival on Ice
activities.description: An annual event where the Nice Carnival comes to life on ice with performances, music, and costumes.
activities.seasonal_notes: Winter transforms the carnival into a unique ice event.
activities.booking_tips: Tickets can be purchased online or at the venue. Dress warmly for the ice rink.

activities.name: Chagall Museum
activities.description: Discover the largest collection of works by Marc Chagall, focusing on his Biblical Message series.
activities.seasonal_notes: Winter is a great time to explore indoor museums and cultural attractions.
activities.booking_tips: Avoid weekends for a quieter experience. Audio guides are available.

activities.name: Winter Hiking in the Esterel Mountains
activities.description: Explore the scenic trails of the Esterel Mountains, offering stunning views and a peaceful winter atmosphere.
activities.seasonal_notes: Winter offers cooler temperatures and clear skies, perfect for hiking.
activities.booking_tips: Check weather conditions before heading out. No booking needed.

activities.name: Nice Acropolis
activities.description: Attend a variety of exhibitions, trade shows, and cultural events hosted at the Nice Acropolis.
activities.seasonal_notes: Winter events are popular at this indoor venue, providing warmth and entertainment.
activities.booking_tips: Check the schedule online and book tickets for specific events in advance.

activities.name: Ice Skating at Place Masséna
activities.description: Enjoy ice skating in the heart of Nice at the outdoor rink set up during the winter season.
activities.seasonal_notes: Winter is the only time the rink is available, offering a fun seasonal activity for all ages.
activities.booking_tips: No booking required, but arrive early to avoid long lines.

activities.name: Villa Kerylos
activities.description: A reconstruction of an ancient Greek villa, offering a unique insight into Greek architecture and design.
activities.seasonal_notes: Winter is a quieter time to visit historical sites, with fewer tourists.
activities.booking_tips: Purchase tickets in advance online, especially during holiday periods.

ranges.notes: Holiday celebrations, mild winter weather (8-13°C), some closures, post-celebration atmosphere
Quiet post-holiday period, winter sales begin, mild temperatures (7-12°C), fewer crowds
Local celebrations, traditional king cake, pleasant winter weather (8-13°C)
Low season, sunny winter days, fewer crowds, comfortable temperatures (6-12°C)
Mild Mediterranean winter, almond trees blooming, pleasant temperatures (7-14°C)
Famous carnival with parades, flower battles, and festivities, increased tourism, book ahead
Final carnival celebrations, still busy but manageable
Early spring, mild temperatures (9-16°C), blooming gardens, pleasant weather
Spring flowers, pleasant temperatures (10-17°C), pre-tourism season, outdoor activities
Pleasant spring weather (12-18°C), Easter period, moderate tourism, outdoor dining
Local gastronomy events, perfect weather (13-19°C), cultural activities
Warm days, beach weather beginning, pre-peak season, excellent conditions
Public holiday, some closures, pleasant weather (14-21°C), local celebrations
Beautiful weather, not yet crowded, perfect temperatures (15-22°C), outdoor activities
Commemorations, some closures, historical significance
International film festival nearby, elegant atmosphere, increased tourism, book ahead
Famous car race in neighboring Monaco, increased tourism, luxury atmosphere
Perfect beach weather (18-24°C), increasing tourism, long days, outdoor activities
Music festival, summer solstice celebrations, free concerts, festive atmosphere
Summer begins in earnest, beaches getting busier, warm weather (19-25°C)
Peak tourist season, busy beaches, hot weather (20-28°C), crowded attractions
National holiday, fireworks over the Bay of Angels, celebrations, book ahead
International jazz festival, very crowded beaches, hot weather (21-28°C), peak tourism
Peak season, extremely crowded, hot weather (21-28°C), high prices
Public holiday, maximum beach crowds, very busy, book everything ahead
Hot weather continues, crowded beaches, peak prices, challenging for sightseeing
Post-peak season begins, excellent swimming weather continues, fewer crowds, pleasant temperatures (18-25°C)
Cultural sites open to public, warm weather, reduced crowds, perfect conditions
Pleasant autumn weather, swimming still possible, comfortable temperatures (15-22°C)
Local gastronomy events, beautiful autumn light, cultural activities, moderate crowds
Public holiday, some closures, mild autumn weather (10-17°C)
Mild autumn, quieter city atmosphere, pleasant temperatures (9-16°C)
Commemorations, some closures, historical significance
Low season begins, pleasant mild days, fewer crowds, comfortable weather (8-15°C)
Holiday decorations, festive atmosphere along Promenade des Anglais, mild winter weather (7-14°C)
Many closures but special atmosphere, family celebrations, mild temperatures
Between Christmas and New Year's - quiet period, pleasant winter weather (6-13°C)
Celebrations along the seafront, festive atmosphere, book ahead

scoreDescription.1: Poor: Unfavorable conditions, extreme weather, overcrowded or limited activities, poor value
scoreDescription.2: Below Average: Less ideal conditions due to excessive crowds or occasional rain, limited value
scoreDescription.3: Average: Standard conditions, typical weather, moderate to high tourism, fair value
scoreDescription.4: Good: Very favorable conditions, pleasant weather, manageable crowds, good value
scoreDescription.5: Excellent: Perfect conditions, special events, ideal weather, moderate crowds, best value

weatherNotes.spring: Mild Mediterranean climate, pleasant temperatures, occasional rain, perfect for outdoor activities
weatherNotes.summer: Hot and dry, excellent beach weather, occasional heatwaves, evening sea breezes
weatherNotes.autumn: Gradually cooling, beautiful light, comfortable for walking, occasional rain
weatherNotes.winter: Mild Mediterranean winter, rarely cold, sunny days, perfect for winter sun

transportation.tram: Efficient year-round, air-conditioned, connects major attractions
transportation.walking: Excellent year-round, especially along Promenade des Anglais
transportation.cycling: Great in spring and autumn, dedicated bike lanes, scenic coastal routes
transportation.boats: Scenic year-round, trips to nearby islands and coastal towns

accommodation.advanceBooking: Recommended 3-6 months ahead for peak season, especially during festivals
